meanings.definition: To persuade someone to do something by using charm or attractiveness.
meanings.sent1: The magician seduces the audience with his amazing tricks.
meanings.sent2: She seduces him with her sweet smile and kind words.
meanings.sent3: The puppy seduces the owner into giving extra treats with its adorable eyes.
meanings.sent4: The melody of the song seduces the listener into a state of relaxation.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of freshly baked cookies seduces everyone in the house to the kitchen.

meanings.definition: To lead astray or entice into a wrong or foolish course of action.
meanings.sent1: The villain seduces the hero into making a wrong decision.
meanings.sent2: Peer pressure can seduce teenagers into risky behaviors.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat seduces the dog into chasing its tail in circles.
meanings.sent4: The darkness of the forest seduces travelers off the safe path.
meanings.sent5: The promise of easy money seduces many into falling for scams.
